tmsyscall package¶

Submodules¶

tmsyscall.mount module¶

Linux mount(2) API wrapper module.

tmsyscall.mount.MNT_DETACH = <MNTFlags.DETACH: 2>¶

Just detach from the tree

tmsyscall.mount.MNT_EXPIRE = <MNTFlags.EXPIRE: 4>¶

Mark for expiry

tmsyscall.mount.MNT_FORCE = <MNTFlags.FORCE: 1>¶

Force unmounting

tmsyscall.mount.MS_BIND = <MSFlags.BIND: 4096>¶

Bind a mount point to a different place .

tmsyscall.mount.MS_DIRSYNC = <MSFlags.DIRSYNC: 128>¶

Directory modifications are synchronous.

tmsyscall.mount.MS_MANDLOCK = <MSFlags.MANDLOCK: 64>¶

Allow mandatory locks on an FS.

tmsyscall.mount.MS_MGC_VAL = <MSFlags.MGC_VAL: 3236757504>¶

Mount flag marker.

tmsyscall.mount.MS_MOVE = <MSFlags.MOVE: 8192>¶

Move a mount point to a different place .

tmsyscall.mount.MS_NOATIME = <MSFlags.NOATIME: 1024>¶

Do not update access times.

tmsyscall.mount.MS_NODEV = <MSFlags.NODEV: 4>¶

Disallow access to device special files.

tmsyscall.mount.MS_NODIRATIME = <MSFlags.NODIRATIME: 2048>¶

Do not update directory access times.

tmsyscall.mount.MS_NOEXEC = <MSFlags.NOEXEC: 8>¶

Disallow program execution.

tmsyscall.mount.MS_NOSUID = <MSFlags.NOSUID: 2>¶

Ignore suid and sgid bits.

tmsyscall.mount.MS_PRIVATE = <MSFlags.PRIVATE: 262144>¶

private mount

tmsyscall.mount.MS_RDONLY = <MSFlags.RDONLY: 1>¶

Mount read-only.

tmsyscall.mount.MS_REC = <MSFlags.REC: 16384>¶

Recursively apply the UNBINDABLE, PRIVATE, SLAVE, or SHARED flags.

tmsyscall.mount.MS_REMOUNT = <MSFlags.REMOUNT: 32>¶

Alter flags of a mounted FS.

tmsyscall.mount.MS_SHARED = <MSFlags.SHARED: 1048576>¶

shared mount

tmsyscall.mount.MS_SLAVE = <MSFlags.SLAVE: 524288>¶

slave mount

tmsyscall.mount.MS_SYNCHRONOUS = <MSFlags.SYNCHRONOUS: 16>¶

Writes are synced at once.

tmsyscall.mount.MS_UNBINDABLE = <MSFlags.UNBINDABLE: 131072>¶

unbindable mount

class tmsyscall.mount.MountEntry(source, target, fs_type, mnt_opts, mount_id, parent_id)[source]¶

Bases: object

Mount table entry data.

fs_type¶
mnt_opts¶
classmethod mount_entry_parse(mount_entry_line)[source]¶

Create a `:class:MountEntry from a mountinfo data line.

The file contains lines of the form:

36 35 98:0 /mnt1 /mnt2 rw,noatime master:1
  • ext3 /dev/root rw,errors=continue
(1)(2)(3) (4) (5) (6) (7)

The numbers in parentheses are labels for the descriptions below:

  1. mount ID: a unique ID for the mount (may be reused after umount(2)).

  2. parent ID: the ID of the parent mount (or of self for the root of this mount namespace’s mount tree).

    If the parent mount point lies outside the process’s root directory (see chroot(2)), the ID shown here won’t have a corresponding record in mountinfo whose mount ID (field 1) matches this parent mount ID (because mount points that lie outside the process’s root directory are not shown in mountinfo). As a special case of this point, the process’s root mount point may have a parent mount (for the initramfs filesystem) that lies outside the process’s root directory, and an entry for that mount point will not appear in mountinfo.

  3. major:minor: the value of st_dev for files on this filesystem (see stat(2)).

  4. root: the pathname of the directory in the filesystem which forms the root of this mount.

  5. mount point: the pathname of the mount point relative to the process’s root directory.

  6. mount options: per-mount options.

  7. optional fields: zero or more fields of the form “tag[:value]”; see below.

  8. separator: the end of the optional fields is marked by a single hyphen.

  9. filesystem type: the filesystem type in the form “type[.subtype]”.

  10. mount source: filesystem-specific information or “none”.

  11. super options: per-superblock options.

mount_id¶
parent_id¶
source¶
target¶
tmsyscall.mount.cleanup_mounts(whitelist_patterns, ignore_exc=False)[source]¶

Prune all mount points except whitelisted ones.

Parameters:ignore_exc (bool) – If True, proceed in a best effort, only logging when unmount fails.
tmsyscall.mount.mount(source, target, fs_type, mnt_flags=0, *mnt_opts_args, **mnt_opts_kwargs)[source]¶

Mount source on target using filesystem type fs_type and mount flags mnt_flags.

NOTE: Mount data argument is not supported.

Params str targetstr target:

tmsyscall.utils module¶

Useful utility functions.

tmsyscall.utils.norm_safe(path)[source]¶

Returns normalized path, aborts if path is not absolute.

tmsyscall.utils.parse_mask(value, mask_enum)[source]¶

Parse a mask into indivitual mask values from enum.

Params int valueint value:
 (Combined) mask value.
Params enum.IntEnum mask_enumenum.IntEnum mask_enum:
 Enum of all possible mask values.
Returns:list - List of enum values and optional remainder.
tmsyscall.utils.mkdir_safe(path, mode=511)[source]¶

Creates directory, if there is any error, aborts the process.

Parameters:path (str) – Path to the directory to create. All intermediary folders will be created.
Return BoolBool:
 True - if the directory was created. False - if the directory already existed.
